posts.cooked:
Am I the only one that finds the fact that Google‚Äôs app-download service is the only one used by the Signal developers somewhat concerning?

Different users operate under different threat models, and there are many of those that consider Google - for all practical purposes de-facto owner of every Google Android mobile device - to be fully prepared to cooperate with their adversary(ies).

While an .apk is available on the Signal site, it is hard to find, and there is no documentation from Signal about the Android variants that the .apk is safe and reliable to operate on. This ‚Äúpush to Google‚Äù erodes the confidence in the application for those that need to remove Google from their trust chain.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Google is never part of the trust chain. If so point out exactly where it is part of the trust chain.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: Using the store is how 99% of Android users get apps. Without the store there‚Äôd probably be no Signal.
Actually you still have to trust Google Play to actually give you Signal Messenger the first time it is installed.
After usernames, I hope the developers replace google maps with openstreetmap

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Not necessarily. Download a public APK then update via Play Store.

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
Frarine:

m I the only one that finds the fact that Google‚Äôs app-download service is the only one used by the Signal developers somewhat concerning?

It isn‚Äôt true but the option is a bit hidden: Signal >> Signal Android APK

It is however the first search result I get when I google for ‚Äúsignal apk‚Äù.

i don‚Äôt like this either, i think signal messenger is too much reliant on google and apple. it is easy to install using google play (and apple app store), but other methods have too many obstacles.

however, i think signal is good enough for basic security where whatsapp and others fail miserably. still, i wouldn‚Äôt use signal for high security situations.

following is the link for installing without google play and google play services.
https://signal.org/android/apk/

i decided to ditch android, includind ungoogled variants, ended up with pinephone. signal is cumbersome in pinephone. so i use signal in laptop with signal-cli and signal-desktop.
https://github.com/AsamK/signal-cli

axolotl exist for linux phones (not android), but haven‚Äôt tested recently this 2.0.4 version.
https://github.com/nanu-c/axolotl

furthermore, this community promotes google sign-in, and other accounts. although not compulsory.

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: Signal uses Discourse so that‚Äôs not in their control.

zetabeta:

it is easy to install using google play (and apple app store), but other methods have too many obstacles.

What obstacles? To install Signal without the Play Store all you have to do is search ‚ÄúSignal APK‚Äù and the top result is Signal‚Äôs official website with the APK download. Click ‚ÄúDownload‚Äù to get the APK and install it on your device. That‚Äôs literally about as obstacle free as you can get.

Signal Desktop isn‚Äôt tied to any app store (though people are begging for it to be added to Microsoft‚Äôs and others, oddly enough).

iOS doesn‚Äôt have any way to sideload apps, so the app store there is the only choice.

Herohtar:

What obstacles?

maybe i am little ‚Äúold-fashioned‚Äù, but i don‚Äôt like to use search engine for everything. if i know i‚Äôm searching drivers for x, i go to x‚Äôs website. so if i want signal apk as a direct install, then i go to signal website. there is no easy way to navigate to that web page from the main site.

signal as a primary client supports walled gardens like google play and apple store almost perfectly, when using something outside of walled gardens then it becomes troublesome. desktop client exists for windows, but even using windows as a primary client is not easy.

i think it is quite clear that signal‚Äôs development prioritizes walled gardens. which is understandable for easy-to-use. but i think signal‚Äôs agenda indicates that promoting closed platforms is not a good idea.

I agree that Signal should make it easier to find on their website. I don‚Äôt know of a way to navigate to the APK download page without using a search engine. Publishing an F-Droid compatible repository or apk files in their Github releases would also be welcome.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Does it matter that you have to use a search engine one time? It‚Äôs a one time download and the app auto updates. It‚Äôs not that hard to do . Is there any reason to implement anything else other than grandstanding non-mainstream solutions? Are you suffering any significant disadvantage by just using the website APK? You‚Äôve made the claim Signal is promoting anything, when achieving mainstream use case requires they use Google Play Store for app delivery. The APK exists, this seems like a non-issue.

The signal forks i found:

Molly

Molly

Molly is an independent Signal fork for Android.

langis.cloudfrancois.fr

Signal Without GCM/FCM

A version of Signal without Google/Firebase Cloud Messaging dependency

https://www.twinhelix.com/apps/signal-foss/

posts.cooked:
List of unofficial forks and patches Wiki
Let‚Äôs collect apps, forks, and patches that provide additional functionality. Before using them, keep in mind that they are not official. They have been created by random people on the Internet as side projects and could be abandoned or taken over by someone else at any time. Even if something provides a highly desired security feature, it could also compromise the security of your system in some other way through a supply chain attack. It is not advisable to use unofficial forks or patches if y‚Ä¶

anon53652:

‚Ä¶I get when I google for ‚Äúsignal apk‚Äù.

My point exactly. Can we agree that there is a large number of Signal users that consider sharing with Google their communication M.O. (if they are optimists - plus the contact list if they are realists, and all of the above plus the message content if they are pessimists) is, at the very least, akin to second-hand cigarette smoke?

Do the developers understand that?
